intro: Calchas betonicoides, commonly known as the common bluebell, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture. Calchas betonicoides is often found in temperate regions of Europe and has been introduced to other parts of the world.
